Dozens of repeat offenders in fish mislabeling snafu

DNA testing on samples from 58 places that sold mislabeled fish last year found 76 percent of the fish samples still weren’t what was advertised. (Globe)

US-Afghan base attacked in Afghanistan

Taliban suicide bombers assaulted the joint air base in eastern Afghanistan early Sunday, sparking a gunbattle that lasted at least two hours. (AP)
Pictures

Scenes from the 2012 Super Bowls

St. John's Prep poses for a championship team photo after defeating Brockton Barry Chin/Globe Staff
Everett players celebrated their win following the MIAA Super Bowl game against Barnstable at Gillette Stadium. Aram Boghosian For The Boston Globe
Bishop's Matthew Allen is tackled by Lynnfield's Andrew Gallo during the first half. Matthew J. Lee/Globe staff
Reading's Liam Kenneally (left) put a big hit on Mansfield's David Collins (right). Barry Chin/Globe Staff
Everett's Jakarrie Washington (left) ran behind a block by teammate Joey White (right). Matthew J. Lee/Globe Staff
Beverly's Ryan Shipp (left) broke up a pass intended for Natick's Brian Dunlap. Matthew J. Lee/Globe Staff
Cathedral's Bryan Cedeno (left) was tackled by Madison Park's C. Brown at Gillette. Aram Boghosian for The Boston Globe
A referee was taken down during the Super Bowl between St. Mary's and Abington. Jonathan Wiggs/ Globe Staff
Wayland's Robert Williams (left) brought down Sharon's Tobenna Modebelu at Bentley. Barry Chin/Globe Staff
Sharon's victorious Head Coach Dave Morse was doused with the traditional bucket of water. Barry Chin/Globe Staff

All-season bike share a possibility

As Hubway closed for winter having reached 676,044 rides, officials are envisioning a future with the bike system expanding and running year-round. (Globe)

Communities seek to limit dispensaries

Towns are rushing to restrict where marijuana dispensaries can be located, or sometimes ban them altogether, before they become legal next month. (Globe)
